div1.p: Russell congratulates Carter on the progress of her work and mentions an outbreak of yellow fever in Rio.

August 9, 1928
Dear Miss Carter:
div1.p:
I beg to thank you for your letter of the 7th
of August. I am glad the work is going so well.

The outbreak of yellow fever in Rio continues.
Last week they reported six cases, and the outbreak has so
far been recognized for eight weeks. Some of our men be-
lieve it had been going on a long time before. This is
another unfortunate incident to arouse interest in yellow
fever.

I hope that the work will continue as satisfac-
torily as it has been doing the last few months.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, F. F. Russell Miss Laura Carter
The Westmoreland
2122 California Street NW
Washington, D.C.
